definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress

sentences.english: And so that clearly is a significant enough incentive for people to seek out those kinds of opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 驱使人们寻找此类机会的动机也是明摆着的。

sentences.english: Clearly a rifle is the weapon of cowards.
sentences.chinese: 明摆着，来复枪是怂人的武器。

sentences.english: I retorted, showing a decided purple witness to refute her.
sentences.chinese: 我回嘴，指着我明摆着的紫斑作为见证来驳倒她。

sentences.english: By Monday morning, it was clear we were bankrupt.
sentences.chinese: 直到周一早晨，明摆着的，我们破产了。

sentences.english: In retrospect, the causes of today's woes seem obvious.
sentences.chinese: 回想起来，造成如今痛苦处境的理由明摆着。

sentences.english: Obviously we need to put those guys back to work; they need to have man-hours out there.
sentences.chinese: 我们明摆着要让这些人重新工作，他们需要有工作量。

sentences.english: Given Reed's track record, why does anyone take him seriously?
sentences.chinese: 里德的记录明摆着，为什么还是有人信以为真呢？
